# utils.desirability.DBox { #spotdesirability.utils.desirability.DBox }

```python
utils.desirability.DBox(low, high, tol=None, missing=None)
```

Implements a box-like desirability function.

The desirability function assigns a value of 1 for inputs within the range `[low, high]`
and a value of 0 for inputs outside this range.

## Attributes {.doc-section .doc-section-attributes}

| Name    | Type             | Description                                                               |
|---------|------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| low     | [float](`float`) | The lower threshold for the desirability function.                        |
| high    | [float](`float`) | The upper threshold for the desirability function.                        |
| tol     | [float](`float`) | A tolerance value to replace desirability values of 0. Defaults to None.  |
| missing | [float](`float`) | The value to use for missing inputs. Defaults to a non-informative value. |

## Functions {.doc-section .doc-section-functions}


Predicts the desirability values for the given input data.


Plots the desirability function.

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> from spotdesirability import DBox
>>> import numpy as np
>>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
# Create a DBox object
>>> dbox = DBox(low=-1.682, high=1.682)
# Predict desirability for a range of inputs
>>> inputs = np.array([-3, -1.682, 0, 1.682, 3])
>>> desirability = dbox.predict(inputs)
>>> print(desirability)
[0. 1. 1. 1. 0.]
# Plot the desirability function
>>> dbox.plot()
```

### predict { #spotdesirability.utils.desirability.DBox.predict }

```python
utils.desirability.DBox.predict(newdata=None, missing=None)
```

Predicts the desirability values for the given input data.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name    | Type                              | Description                                                                                                 | Default   |
|---------|-----------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|
| newdata | [array](`array`) - [like](`like`) | The input data for which to compute desirability values. If None, an empty array is used. Defaults to None. | `None`    |
| missing | [float](`float`)                  | The value to use for missing inputs. Defaults to the object's `missing` attribute.                          | `None`    |

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type                                        | Description                                 |
|--------|---------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
|        | [numpy](`numpy`).[ndarray](`numpy.ndarray`) | The desirability values for the input data. |

#### Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> from spotdesirability import DBox
>>> import numpy as np
# Create a DBox object
>>> dbox = DBox(low=-1.682, high=1.682)
>>> inputs = np.array([-3, -1.682, 0, 1.682, 3])
>>> desirability = dbox.predict(inputs)
>>> print(desirability)
[0. 1. 1. 1. 0.]
```
